abstract: Four executives that have been in the news recently are part of a larger club in Manhattan: Ivy League hockey players who have traded their sticks and pads for Wall Street.
snippet: Four executives that have been in the news recently are part of a larger club in Manhattan: Ivy League hockey players who have traded their sticks and pads for Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: 3:24 p.m. | Updated What do Philip Falcone of Harbinger, Douglas Hirsch of Seneca Capital and two of the newly minted Goldman Sachs partners, Matthew Mallgrave and Scott Barringer, have in common?

headline.main: From Hockey Rink to Wall Street

byline.original: By Evelyn M. Rusli and Peter Lattman
